title: Gaza ceasefire deal being finalised
byline: No byline

title: Most passenger buses built on lorry chassis, not up to mark in passenger comfort
byline: Most buses which currently ply on Sri Lankan roads are built on lorry chassis are not in conformity with modern mass transportation standards in terms of passenger comfort, yet they cannot be replaced with quality low–floor buses at once because of economic conditions of the country, an official said yesterday.

title: Tax hikes killed hopes for new vehicle imports: Dayasiri
byline: The government has relaxed restrictions on vehicle imports, but the imposition of four layers of taxation, coupled with the lack of consideration for the manufacturing year specified by the President, has effectively dashed the hopes of bringing new vehicles into the country, parliamentarian Dayasiri Jayasekera said.

title: TRCSL denies social media claims of telecom price hikes
byline: The Telecommunication Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) today denied reports circulating on social media about an increase in charges by telecommunication service providers for their packages.

title: President leaves to China
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake left for China today on a four-day official visit. He was joined by Ministers Vijitha Herath and Bimal Ratnayake.

title: Japan issues Tsunami advisory after 6.6 magnitude earthquake
byline: Japan’s Meteorological Agency has issued a tsunami advisory after a 6.9 magnitude earthquake occurred off the coast of southwest Japan.

title: Sri Lanka’s red rice shortage: a clash of demand, supply challenges and political colouring
byline: Red rice which holds both cultural and dietary significance is now in short supply in the market, and the phenomenon is attributed to multiple factors despite political colouring of the issue.

title: Psychiatrist gives false reason to avoid posting to Mullaitivu Hospital
byline: Medical associations have raised concerns over a potential precedent after a psychiatrist assigned to the District General Hospital in Mullaitivu requested a reversal of her transfer.

title: Over 7,000 eyes donated last year, restoring vision to those in need
byline: A total of 7,144 eyes were donated last year, providing the gift of sight to individuals in need, according to the Sri Lanka Eye Donation Society.

title: President arrives in Beijing
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived at the Beijing International Airport today (14) at 10:25 a.m. Beijing time, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: NBRO issues landslide warning for five districts
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued a 24-hour landslide warning for the districts of Kandy, Badulla, Kurunegala, Matale and Nuwara Eliya.

title: Somawathiya Chaitya road flooded due to rains
byline: Due to heavy rainfall in several provinces, including the North-Central Province, the road leading to the Somawathiya Chaitya has been inundated, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said.

title: ’Clean Sri Lanka’ starts only on Feb 01, don’t get confused: Govt
byline: Amid uncertainties over the ’Clean Sri Lanka’ project which has received both positive and negative feedback, a Deputy Minister clarified that the project is slated to be implemented only on February 01.

title: BCCI proposes stricter rules: Virat, Gambhir to be affected most
byline: In the aftermath of Team India’s underwhelming Test series in Australia, the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is reportedly set to implement stricter rules.

title: Digital NICs within this month
byline: The digital National Identity Cards (NICs) will be issued by this month, Digital Economy Deputy Minister Eranga Weeraratne said.

title: Marble-sized balls force Sydney beaches to close
byline: Months after mysterious black balls forced the closure of some of Sydney’s most famous beaches, small marble-like debris has begun washing up on the city’s shores again.

title: TikTok users flock to Chinese app RedNote as US ban looms
byline: TikTok users in the US are migrating to a Chinese app called RedNote with the threat of a ban just days away.

title: Customs introduces solution to accelerate container clearance
byline: In response to ongoing delays at the Colombo Port, the Sri Lanka Customs has introduced a special programme aimed to accelerate container clearance.

title: SLAF chief conducts test landing on Hingurakgoda runway
byline: The ongoing transformation of Hingurakgoda runway is progressing towards meeting international aviation standards, with the goal of accommodating the widely used A320 and Boeing 737 aircraft, the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) said.

title: S Korea begins impeachment trial against suspended president
byline: South Korea’s Constitutional Court has held its first hearing to decide if suspended President Yoon Suk Yeol should be removed from office after his shock martial law attempt last month.
